ratings.question_text: What is your overall assessment of this course?

narratives.question_text: How would you summarize AFAM 505 01/AMST 643 01 for a fellow student? Would you recommend AFAM 505 01/AMST 643 01 to another student? Why or why not?
comments: It covers edge-cutting science and technology in water treatment.I would certainly recommend it to another student.
Absolutely. One can learn a broad spectrum of knowledge in different fields.
If you want to learn more about environmental engineering I would definitely recommend the class.
Interesting class that covers many important environmental engineering concepts. If new to EnvE and want to get an idea of what topics are important/relevant, it's a great class to take.
A good summary of physical and chemical processes in Environmental Engineering.

ENAS 642 provides an overview of traditional physical and chemical processes in environmental engineering, as well as an introduction to more novel membrane processes. These are key topics to understand, particularly in our program, even if they do not directly pertain to your personal research, so I would recommend this course.

narratives.question_text: How did this course deepen your knowledge of your discipline/profession? To what extent did this course contribute to your dissertation/research?
comments: The knowledge I earned from this course will continue to inspire me for my dissertation work and in my future career back to China.
Not directly applicable to my research interests, but useful for a broader understanding of the field and a better appreciation of the rest of the department.
As someone who is new to EnvE, the class was incredibly useful. I will keep the class notes and use them for years to come.
All the topic covered were very relevant.

Most of the material covered in this class does not pertain to the topics I address in my research, but it comes up frequently in conversations with other students and in the seminars on Wednesdays, so it is integral for my general understanding of my discipline.
